H0.text: Weathering is the process that makes it possible for the nutrients from organic material to be added to soil.

H1.text: Erosion is the process that makes it possible for nutrients from organic material to be added to soil.

H2.text: Decomposition is the process that makes it possible for the nutrients from organic material to be added to soil.

H3.text: Succession is the process that makes it possible for the nutrients from organic material to be added to soil.

A4.text: Decomposition is the process by which dead organic substances are broken down into simpler organic or inorganic matter such as carbon dioxide, water, simple sugars and mineral salts.

A5.text: Decomposition is a part of the nutrient cycle and is essential for recycling the finite matter that occupies physical space in the biosphere.
